version_description:
This is a maintenance update which includes a small collection of fixes to the v6 codebase.

The notable fix in this update is for the bug which affected CMS for some customers where a file naming conflict could result in a clip not being stored in the library.

- - - - - - -
If you are a fan of FiLMiC Pro and are pleased with our commitment to continual quality improvement and feature delivery, or have been pleased by the level of support you've received please consider leaving a review on the Apple App Store. Reminder - Reviews are reset with each update, so if you left a review in the past, please consider reposting a review for the update.

The FiLMiC team is proud of our product and the support we provide our customers. If you have ANY issue at all with the app or a question that you have not found an answer to elsewhere, please contact us directly at support@filmicpro.com

v6.1 is an important update for FiLMiC Pro v6:
- The functionality in the 'Cinematographer Kit' is now available as an optional purchase for customers using the iPhone 6s, 6s Plus, SE and iPad Pro 9.7. The team has worked hard to optimize the app to be able to bring these features to the earlier devices and we are pleased to announce that the work has completed and we are very happy with the performance of the new color and tone controls (including Log) on these devices.
- The app and quick start guides have been localized for eight languages in addition to English: Brazilian Portuguese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Simplified & Traditional Chinese, and Spanish. We have plans to roll out additional languages in subsequent updates.

- - - - - - -
If you are a fan of FiLMiC Pro and are pleased with our commitment to continual quality improvement and feature delivery, or have been pleased by the level of support you've received please consider leaving a review on the Apple App Store. Remember that reviews are reset with each update, so if you left a review in the past, please consider posting a review for the update.

The FiLMiC team is proud of our product and the support we provide our customers. If you have ANY issue at all with the app or a question that you have not found an answer to elsewhere, please contact us directly at support@filmicpro.com

Small Update:
* Fixes a bug which caused presets to disappear

Fixes and performance improvements.
- Fix for stabilization on iPhone 8 and 8 Plus when used with resolutions above 1080p.

Contact us with any questions: support@filmicpro.com

v6.3.3 is a maintenance release which includes the following:

- Resolved: Stabilization issue at resolutions above 1080p on iPhone 8/8+ and X.

- Resolved: Audio issue that would create an audible 'click' at app launch.

- Resolved: Front-facing camera perspective issue.

- Resolved: Issue for iPad customers who were unable to restore their Cinematographer Kit purchase.

- Miscellaneous fixes and performance improvements.

Please contact us with any questions or suggestions: support@filmicpro.com

Expanded iPhone X Support:
- A large, detailed audio meter as well as information such as quality setting, recording time remaining and color temperature fill your iPhone X screen.

Bluetooth Microphone Support:
- Connect a bluetooth microphone to your device and then enable 'Bluetooth Microphone' in the audio settings within the app.
- Note: Bluetooth microphone audio quality can vary widely. For best results, we recommend using Apple AirPods.

Select All Videos in the Library:
- Long press on the video selection button to select or deselect all clips in the library.

New 'Auto Shutter' Support:
- All devices gain the ability to set shutter behavior to best match your location's electrical power frequency: This can be found in the settings menu at the bottom of the frame rate menu. Options are for 'auto', '50hz' and '60hz'.

Contact us with any questions: support@filmicpro.com

A couple quick fixes and also all of the features of v6.4:

Expanded iPhone X Support:
- A large, detailed audio meter as well as information such as quality setting, recording time remaining and color temperature fill your iPhone X screen.

Bluetooth Microphone Support:
- Connect a bluetooth microphone to your device and then enable 'Bluetooth Microphone' in the audio settings within the app.
- Note: Bluetooth microphone audio quality can vary widely. For best results, we recommend using Apple AirPods.

Select All Videos in the Library:
- Long press on the video selection button to select or deselect all clips in the library.

New 'Auto Shutter' Support:
- All devices gain the ability to set shutter behavior to best match your location's electrical power frequency: This can be found in the settings menu at the bottom of the frame rate menu. Options are for 'auto', '50hz' and '60hz'.

Contact us with any questions: support@filmicpro.com

v6.4.5 adds a couple small fixes for specific device edge-cases, plus all that was delivered in v6.4.4:
- New: Full-Frame focus and exposure
—— Double-tap the focus and/or exposure reticle to expand the area of interest. When expanded, the app will use the entire screen with a center-weighted average in calculating focus and/or exposure. Double-tap again to return to reticle mode. This feature is ideal for situations where hassle-free setting of your image is desired. Perfect for vlogger’s!

- Updated: The latest version of DJI’s integration framework has been implemented. This will resolve annoying connection issues etc with with your DJI OSMO Mobile.

- Fixes and performance improvements.
Minor maintenance release which includes fixes and performance improvements.

Minor maintenance release which includes fixes and performance improvements. Initial, basic support for DJI OSMO mobile 2. (Moviegoers in the United States and Canada can see UNSANE by Steven Soderbergh in theaters everywhere, which was shot with 3 iPhones using FiLMiC Pro and FiLMiC Remote)

* Fixes a bug where some buttons disappeared for non-English language users. Moviegoers in the US and Canada can see FiLMiC Pro on the big screen currently in Steven Soderbergh's UNSANE in theaters now. Shot with iPhones using FiLMiC Pro and FiLMiC Remote.
Regression bug conflict fixed for headphone monitoring.

This version includes the following notable features, and fixes:

— DJI OSMO Mobile 2 Support: The OSMO 2 power/mode button is used to turn on and off the gimbal as well as to switch from free to follow mode. Per DJI, the OSMO Mobile 2 mode button cannot be reassigned. For this reason the zoom slider of the OSMO Mobile 2 is used for mode selection in FiLMiC Pro:
—— Push the zoom slider up or down to change modes. Mode 1 is pan/tilt of the gimbal via the joystick. Mode 2 is reticle mode. Push left or right on the joystick to lock/unlock focus and exposure. Mode 3 is manual mode. Push left or right on the joystick to adjust manual focus or manual exposure.

— DJI OSMO Mobile (first generation) new features:
—— Added support for triple-tap of trigger button to switch from front to rear cameras.

— New Settings Panel Framework: Look and feel is identical, but performance and reliability are greatly improved.

— Localization Issues Fixed: Some languages had conflicts with button use. This is resolved.

— Camera Roll Permission Resolved: If permission had not been granted, camera roll transfers were subject to failure.

— Miscellaneous fixes for stability and performance.

- - - - - - -

This version includes the following notable new features as well as bug fixes and plenty of performance improvements:

— New and improved audio framework! Our new framework is more performant and capable than ever and resolves many compatibility issues with third party microphones (such as MV88 and iRig Mic HD) and allows for better capability expansion in the future.

— New on-boarding permissions screen when FiLMiC Pro is first launched.

We heard you loud and clear! This version includes best in class support for the Zhiyun Smooth 4 handheld stabilizer, offering unparalleled manual control for the ultimate tactile shooting experience!

— Press the centre mode button to cycle through three modes: reticle - auto - and manual. In reticle and auto mode press left on the thumbwheel to lock/unlock exposure, and right to lock/unlock focus. Pressing up on the thumbwheel will lock/unlock both reticles concurrently.

— Use the side handwheel for silky smooth focus pulls, and scroll the centre thumbwheel for manual exposure adjustments.

— Press the target button (crosshairs) to switch between controlling focus and zoom with the side handwheel.

— Press the quick camera selector button to toggle between the front and rear cameras. Tap and hold on dual lens iPhones to bring up the lens selector and scroll through wide, tele, zoom and selfie cameras.

— There is too much other good stuff to cover here, so make sure you check our website for a full Smooth 4 tutorial.

— Language support for Russian and Korean.

— Miscellaneous fixes for stability and performance.

v6.7.1 brings iOS 12 support to FiLMiC Pro!

v6.7 new features:
We heard you loud and clear! This version includes best in class support for the Zhiyun Smooth 4 handheld stabilizer, offering unparalleled manual control for the ultimate tactile shooting experience!
— Press the centre mode button to cycle through three modes: reticle - auto - and manual. In reticle and auto mode press left on the thumbwheel to lock/unlock exposure, and right to lock/unlock focus. Pressing up on the thumbwheel will lock/unlock both reticles concurrently.

— Use the side handwheel for silky smooth focus pulls, and scroll the centre thumbwheel for manual exposure adjustments.

— Press the target button (crosshairs) to switch between controlling focus and zoom with the side handwheel.

— Press the quick camera selector button to toggle between the front and rear cameras. Tap and hold on dual lens iPhones to bring up the lens selector and scroll through wide, tele, zoom and selfie cameras.

— There is too much other good stuff to cover here, so make sure you check our website for a full Smooth 4 tutorial.

— Language support for Russian and Korean.

— Miscellaneous fixes for stability and performance.

v6.7.2 is a small release which includes fixes and performance improvements. Notable issues resolved:
- Freezing of the imaging panel on devices running iOS 12.
- Crash of Xs, Xs Max and Xr on some devices. This resolution may also require a hard reset of your device to reset the media server.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.7.3 is a small release which includes fixes and performance improvements. Notables:
- Resolved black screen issue on older devices.
- Resolved anamorphic preview glitch.
- Resolved green screen glitch when stabilization enabled at certain resolutions.
- Resolved horizontal image flip issue.
If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.7.4 includes the following fixes, performance improvements and changes:
- Resolved performance issues on old devices (iPhone 5s, iPad Air, iPad Mini).
- Responsive zebra and focus peaking live analytics restored for devices running iOS 11.
- Resolved missing playback framerate value when system language set to Russian.
- Resolved issues with stabilization on iPhone XS/XS Max and XR.
- Restored support for 60fps recording at 1080p on the iPhone 6 Plus.
- Improved focus reticle responsiveness in 1080p on latest gen iPhones.
- Restored support for 540p recording.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.7.5 is a small maintenance release that includes fixes and performance improvements. Notable in this release:
- Resolved an issue related to using FiLMiC Remote or the FiLMiC Pro Apple Watch app: In certain cases, any lag in the Watch or Remote app preview could be introduced into the final footage.

If you have any questions or suggestions please contact us at: support@filmicpro.com

LogV2 is here!
•We are thrilled to introduce a major update to the FLAT and LOG gamma curves included in the Cinematographer Kit in-app purchase. LogV2 provides even more dynamic range and lower noise! Get up to 2.5 extra stops of dynamic range for the ultimate in cinematic video acquisition on mobile.
•Official LUTs available for free on our website! Download our FiLMiC deFLAT and deLOG LUT pack today to quickly and easily conform your footage to rec.709 in your NLE of choice.
•Our V2 deFLAT and deLOG LUTs are also directly available in LumaFusion and VideoLUT apps for color grading on the go. 

More Extreme
•We have boosted the target bitrate for the Extreme quality setting in the app to 120mbps for 4k resolution for most recent iPhones and iPads*. The V2 FLAT and LOG gamma curves will be able to take advantage of this extra data to render that gorgeous additional dynamic range detail.

RGB channels visualized in the waveform
•Tap through the timecode medallion and you will find our brand new Chrominance Waveform

Bug fixes and optimizations
•Resolved low quality live preview when using FiLMiC Remote
•Improved re-timing for fast/slow motion clips when shooting in HEVC
•High-speed frame rates restored at 2k and 3k shooting resolutions
•Resolved preview display glitch upon first launch of the app
•General bug fixes and performance improvements 

If you have any questions or suggestions please contact us at: support@filmicpro.com

(* devices with A11 and newer processors)

v6.8.1 includes fixes and performance improvements for Flat/LogV2 gamma curves (included in the Cinematographer Kit in-app purchase).

V6.8.0 New Features:
LogV2 is here!
•We are thrilled to introduce a major update to the FLAT and LOG gamma curves included in the Cinematographer Kit in-app purchase. LogV2 provides even more dynamic range and lower noise! Get up to 2.5 extra stops of dynamic range for the ultimate in cinematic video acquisition on mobile.
•Official LUTs available for free on our website! Download our FiLMiC deFLAT and deLOG LUT pack today to quickly and easily conform your footage to rec.709 in your NLE of choice.
•Our V2 deFLAT and deLOG LUTs are also directly available in LumaFusion and VideoLUT apps for color grading on the go. 

More Extreme
•We have boosted the target bitrate for the Extreme quality setting in the app to 120mbps for 4k resolution for most recent iPhones and iPads*. The V2 FLAT and LOG gamma curves will be able to take advantage of this extra data to render that gorgeous additional dynamic range detail.

RGB channels visualized in the waveform
•Tap through the timecode medallion and you will find our brand new Chrominance Waveform

v6.8.2 includes important bug fixes and performance optimizations:

- When switching lenses on devices with dual rear cameras your stabilization settings are honored.
- Log is now labeled as ‘Log V2’ under the gamma panel.
- Miscellaneous fixes for stability and performance.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

Support for the Movi Cinema Robot gimbal is here!

We heard you loud and clear: v6.9.0 of FiLMiC Pro includes support for the Movi Cinema Robot gimbal, offering unparalleled manual control for the ultimate tactile shooting experience.

— Pair FiLMiC Pro with your Movi under the Settings > Hardware menu.

— Once connected press the centre d-pad button to cycle through three modes: reticle - auto - and manual.

— In reticle and auto mode press left on the thumbwheel to lock/unlock exposure, and right to lock/unlock focus. Pressing up on the thumbwheel will lock/unlock both reticles concurrently.

— Press down on the d-pad to switch between rear and selfie cameras. Long press down on the d-pad to access additional lenses on dual lens iPhones (tele and zoom).

— Long press left on the d-pad in reticle and auto modes for manual exposure override; and long press right for manual focus override.

— Press the Action Trigger beneath record button on Movi to lock/unlock the roll motor.

— Long press the Action Trigger to reveal the Action Menu: this allows you to adjust your Movi response and window speeds directly from the gimbal; reassign the Action Trigger to ‘freeze’ mode; and quickly launch the library without having to tap the screen.

— For a full rundown on using the Movi Cinema Robot with FiLMiC Pro, make sure you check out the official tutorial on our YouTube channel.

— Miscellaneous fixes for stability and performance.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com.

v6.9.1 contains bug fixes and performance optimizations.

v6.9.0 New Features:
Support for the Movi Cinema Robot gimbal is here! FiLMiC Pro includes support for the Movi Cinema Robot gimbal, offering unparalleled manual control for the ultimate tactile shooting experience. For a full rundown on using the Movi Cinema Robot with FiLMiC Pro, make sure you check out the official tutorial on our YouTube channel.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com.

v6.9.2 adds the following new feature in addition to performance optimizations:

— Now when FiLMiC Pro is under the control of our companion app FiLMiC Remote, a single tap on the interface will hide all on screen elements. Tap again to reveal them. Perfect if you want a clean video-out over HDMI for live streaming or monitoring purposes.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.9.3 adds the following new features in addition to performance optimizations:

— White Balance Auto Lock: In addition to auto white balance and white balance lock, we’ve added a third state under the Imaging Panel: White balance auto-lock on record. Now if you tap the AWB icon so it turns orange, your white balance will be automatically locked when you start a recording to prevent fluctuation, and then automatically unlocked when you end it. We have a full tutorial on our official Youtube Channel so make sure you check it out.

— Stabilization enabled by default on first launch for iPhones with an A10 processor and newer: If this is the first time you’ve downloaded and opened FiLMiC Pro, you will find stabilization enabled by default on your first launch to ensure your shots are as smooth as possible. You can disable stabilization under the Settings menu.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.9.4 adds the following improvements in addition to performance optimizations:

— Improved handling of accidental external microphone disconnects during a recording.
— Moondog anamorphic lens and 35mm adapter image flip can be enabled concurrently.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.9.6 includes important stability improvements and performance optimizations.

New Features:
— Under ‘Settings’ you will find the all new FiLMiCFest button. Tap it to get all the details on our 2019 video contest!

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.9.7 contains an important hotfix that resolves an issue that prevented recording when using the AAC audio format or timelapse mode.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

This is a minor maintenance update that includes fixes and performance improvements.

v6.9.9 includes important stability improvements and performance optimizations for iOS 13.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

6.9.10 includes an important fix that resolves a crash that could occur when disconnecting some models of iPhone from our companion app, FiLMiC Remote.

v6.10.0 includes important iOS 13 stability improvements and performance optimizations in addition to the following new features:

— Support for the ultra wide lens on the iPhone 11 and iPhone 11 Pro.
— Updated zoom lens API so it utilises the ultra wide lens on iPhone 11/11 Pro.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.10.1 includes stability improvements and performance optimizations in addition to the following fix:

— Resolves an issue where scrolling in the FiLMiC library with clips selected would deselect them.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

V6.10.2 includes performance optimizations in addition to the following enhancement:

— Improves the highlight exposure system for the iPhone 11, 11 Pro, and 11 Pro Max.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.10.3 includes performance optimizations and under the hood improvements and is recommended for all users.

Be sure to check out our new photo app FiLMiC Firstlight. We think you will love it! Pre-order your FREE download now and be one of the first to get it on the November 8th release date.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.10.4 includes important stability improvements and performance optimizations in addition to the following new feature:

- Firstlight quick launch button is available under the Settings menu. Now you can effortlessly switch between FiLMiC Pro and Firstlight with just a tap.

Multicam support is not available in this update but will be coming soon. Stay tuned for an announcement in late January and many thanks for your patience.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

IMPORTANT: This version of FiLMiC Pro removes support for the WD Passport Pro. If your workflow requires the automatic archive feature, please do not update until your project is complete.

v6.10.5 of FiLMiC Pro is a significant update with the following notable new features and improvements:

— Brand new library! Our library has received some serious love and has been rewritten from the ground up. It offers the following improvements:
- The library is now much snappier and scrolling is more fluid.
- Batch selecting clips is now easier with the number of clips selected clearly displayed.
- The player has a new and improved transport control with support for Airplay.

— Expanded timecode support:
- The timecode track which can be enabled under FiLMiC Pro's Settings > CMS menu is now compliant with all major NLEs including Premiere Pro, FCPX and Davinci Resolve! This makes syncing multicam footage shot on multiple iPhones running FiLMiC Pro an absolute breeze.

— Quick launch DoubleTake from lens menu:
- While we are still hard at working incorporating multi-cam functionality into FiLMiC Pro, you can get an early taste of the power of multicam with our new free app: DoubleTake (requires iPhone XS or newer).

— Numerous bug fixes and performance improvements.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v.6.10.6 includes further stability improvements and resolves a bug that prevented FiLMiC Remote from successfully initiating a recording.

And in case you missed all the major new enhancements we included in v6.10.5:

IMPORTANT: This version of FiLMiC Pro removes support for the WD Passport Pro. If your workflow requires the automatic archive feature, please do not update until your project is complete.

v6.10.7 of FiLMiC Pro restores support for the Zhiyun Smooth 4 gimbal.

Thanks for your patience while we resolved this issue.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.10.8 of FiLMiC Pro includes further stability improvements and performance optimizations.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.10.9 of FiLMiC Pro includes numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements for a better shooting experience:

- Zoom quality loss indicator restored to zoom rocker.
- Resolves an issue where the preview could become choppy after rotating the device with a high speed framerate selected.
- Improved handling of external audio devices.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.11.0 of FiLMiC Pro includes numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements for a better shooting experience. Key improvements in this release include:

- Improved framerate adherence on A13 devices when shooting 4K 60fps in portrait.
- Volume keys now trigger a recording by default when no headset is connected. This can be disabled under the ‘Device’ menu in settings.
- Transitioning from reticle to auto mode via a double-tap on the focus and exposure reticle has been improved.
- An issue that prevented successfully locking shutter speed on the iPhone 8 has been resolved.
- Transfer mechanism for copying clips to the Photos app has been greatly improved.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.11.1 of FiLMiC Pro includes numerous performance enhancements and bug fixes and is recommended for all filmmakers:

- Resolves a number of instances where audio monitoring could stop working.
- Improves framerate adherence on the iPhone X.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.0 of FiLMiC Pro is a big one. It includes full support for the DJI OSMO 3 & 4 and the ability to output a clean feed over HDMI! Key features and improvements in this release include:

- FiLMiC Pro now fully supports the DJI OSMO Mobile 3 and OSMO 4. This has been highly requested and we thank everyone for their patience. All models of OSMO are now supported (OSMO 1/2/3/4) in FiLMiC Pro. Just open Settings > Hardware and enable ‘DJI OSMO Mobile’ and it will automatically detect your model.
- Additional functionality has been added to the DJI OSMO series of gimbal including support for digital zoom in modes 2 & 3 by pressing up/down on the joystick. A new full frame reticle mode has also been added.
- Clean HDMI Out support allows you to output a clean feed over HDMI or wirelessly using Airplay! Enable it under the Hardware menu in Settings. Perfect for integrating FiLMiC Pro into your live studio with the ATEM Mini by Blackmagic Design, or transforming your smartphone into a webcam with the Elgato Cam Link 4K.
- Numerous bug fixes and performance optimizations.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.1 of FiLMiC Pro updates the license key for the Zhiyun Smooth 4, which is required to ensure continued functionality with this gimbal.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.2 of FiLMiC Pro updates the license key for the Zhiyun Smooth 4, which is required to ensure continued functionality with this gimbal.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v.6.12.3 is our final update that will support iOS 11 and iOS 12. 
This update corrects an issue where the iPhone 6/6+ mistakenly showed the Clean HDMI Out feature. iPhone 6/6+ does not support the Metal features used to run Clean HDMI Out.

Please note that we will be launching our first update for iOS 14 in the coming days.

Previous v6.12 banner updates remain including:

- FiLMiC Pro now fully supports the DJI OSMO Mobile 3 and OSMO 4. This has been highly requested and we thank everyone for their patience. All models of OSMO are now supported (OSMO 1/2/3/4) in FiLMiC Pro. Just open Settings > Hardware and enable ‘DJI OSMO Mobile’ and it will automatically detect your model.
- Additional functionality has been added to the DJI OSMO series of gimbal including support for digital zoom in modes 2 & 3 by pressing up/down on the joystick. A new full frame reticle mode has also been added.
- Clean HDMI Out support allows you to output a clean feed over HDMI or wirelessly using Airplay! Enable it under the Hardware menu in Settings. Perfect for integrating FiLMiC Pro into your live studio with the ATEM Mini by Blackmagic Design, or transforming your smartphone into a webcam with the Elgato Cam Link 4K.
- Numerous bug fixes and performance optimizations.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.4 of FiLMiC Pro adds support for iOS 14 and contains minor fixes and enhancements, including:

- Updated permission handling for saving to Photos app in iOS 14.
- Minor improvements to our internal library.
- Removal of support for iOS 12 and earlier. iOS 13 or later is now required to receive future updates to FiLMiC Pro.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.5 of FiLMiC Pro addresses an issue in which the library would fail to present clips if launched after rotating the device into landscape.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v.6.12.6 of FiLMiC Pro includes numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements, including:

- Better handling of audio routing for monitoring and clip playback.
- Minor enhancements to improve the audio input gain slider.
- Added iOS voiceover accessibility support.
- Improved performance when using our companion app, FiLMiC Remote.
- Assorted bug fixes for a smoother shooting experience.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings, please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.7 of FiLMiC Pro adds support for 10-bit Dolby Vision HDR on 12 series iPhones! You’ll find the option to enable Dolby Vision under the Settings > Resolution menu. Just scroll down to reveal the Dolby Vision toggle.

A few things to be aware of when it comes to shooting in Dolby Vision:
- It is limited to 30fps in 4K and 60fps in 1080p.
- A Dolby Vision HDR compatible display is required to consume it.
- Dolby Vision HDR is much more processor intensive than SDR. For long record times we recommend SDR.
- Dolby Vision is not compatible with the Cinematographer Kit in-app purchase.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com

v6.12.8 of FiLMiC Pro improves performance when used with our companion app FiLMiC Remote.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com, and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro please consider leaving a review.

v6.12.9 of FiLMiC Pro includes plenty of bug fixes, performance improvements, and an exciting new feature:

- FiLMiC Pro now supports stereo audio using the in-built microphones on the iPhone XS and newer! You’ll find stereo audio available as an input option under the Settings > Audio menu.
- We’ve improved performance when using FiLMiC Pro with our companion app FiLMiC Remote.
- We resolved an issue that could prevent slow motion clips from being retimed when saved directly to the Photos app.
- We improved the audio routing when viewing clips in the library with an external microphone connected.
- Numerous other improvements to help deliver a smoother and more efficient shooting experience.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v.6.13.0 brings full support for 10-bit SDR capture with optimized curves to 12 series devices! This is a giant leap forward for mobile filmmakers and offers improved video quality and exciting new possibilities for color grading workflows. Release highlights include:

— 10-bit capture on 12 series devices (iPhone 12/12 Mini/12 Pro/12 Pro Max only).
- Open Settings > Resolution, and scroll down to reveal our new format stepper. You can choose between 8-bit; 10-bit; and Dolby Vision HDR.

— With 10-bit selected, Cinematographer Kit owners (optional in-app purchase) will get a new suite of fully optimized curves under the gamma panel, designed to get the most out of 10-bit capture:
- Linear replaces Dynamic.
- HLG replaces Flat.
- LogV3 replaces LogV2 when recording in 10-bit for the ultimate in dynamic range. We recommend Log V3 to get the most out of 10-bit capture, especially if you intend to grade your video in post.

— We have updated our Library and Imaging Panel to display your currently selected bit-depth, so you’ll always know what you’re filming in.

— An updated deLogV3 LUT is available for free on our website. Use this to quickly go from 10-bit Log to Rec709 ready footage in your NLE of choice.

— Please note the following in relation to 10-bit capture:
- When using the Cinematographer Kit (optional in-app purchase) 10-bit capture is limited to 30fps at 2K and above, and 60fps at 1080p.

— We have also made performance tweaks and fixed some bugs for all devices, including restoring Cinematographer Kit support to the iPhone 6s/SE models.

We can’t wait to hear what you think of 10-bit capture! And please share some clips with us on social. If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com - and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review. Happy filming!

v6.13.3 of FiLMiC Pro includes numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements, including:

— Zebras and Clipping analytics now use an identical threshold.
— Saturation and Vibrancy sliders available in CineKit in-app purchase have been optimized for 10-bit capture (iPhone 12 series only).
— Better messaging around supported 10-bit frame rates on iPhone 12 and 12 Mini.
— Resolved an issue that would prevent the FiLMiC splash screen from displaying when launching the app.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.13.4 of FiLMiC Pro includes numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements, including:
— New and improved FiLMiC Sync for saving presets to the cloud! Sign in with Apple, Twitter, or Google accounts. We now also offer password reset within the app for your FiLMiC Sync account, and better cross platform support.
— Improvements to 10-bit capture pipeline on 12 series iPhones.
— Plenty of under the hood improvements to make your filmmaking experience even smoother and more performant.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.13.5 of FiLMiC Pro improves the performance of the histogram and waveform scopes, which are accessible by tapping the timecode medallion.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.14.0 of FiLMiC Pro is a major update that includes the following new features:
— Quick lens picker: You can now switch lenses directly from the main camera UI on iPhones with wide aspect screens. No more diving into settings to switch between lenses! We’ve also revamped the camera menu under settings to include more information about each lens including the aperture and 35mm equivalent focal length.
— Advanced CMS support: Under Settings > CMS > you now can access ‘Advanced’ CMS which allows you to adopt a file naming scheme found on traditional cinema cameras. This will help integrate FiLMiC Pro into more traditional workflows. Our previous CMS option is still there, and has just been rebranded as ‘Slate’.
— Plenty of minor bug fixes and performance improvements.

Note: Quick lens picker unavailable on original iPhone SE and iPod Touch.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.14.1 of FiLMiC Pro includes the following feature and performance improvements:

— Ultra-wide selfie lens support for M1 iPad Pros!
— Reticle interaction has been greatly improved, especially when reticles overlap with each other or with the manual arcs. You should find these much easier to interact with.
— Improvements to status messaging on external displays when viewing a clip in the library with clean HDMI out enabled.
— Horizontal image flip and vertical image flip (35mm lens adapter) can now be enabled concurrently.
— Live analytics no longer available on iPhone 6s/6s+/SEgen1 when in 4K to improve capture reliability. Max frame rate for Log capture has been reduced to 25fps to improve frame rate adherence.
— Lots of minor bug fixes for a smoother shooting experience.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.14.2 of FiLMiC Pro includes general performance improvements, as well as a brand new feature for M1 iPad Pros:

**M1 iPad Pro Only**:
— Advanced Scopes for M1 iPad Pros: If you happen to have a new M1 iPad Pro then you get access to a brand new advanced scopes view for external displays - perfect for studio use!
- - When connected to an external display via HDMI or Airplay, you can now cycle between Clean HDMI Out and Scopes under the ‘Settings’ > ‘Hardware’ menu, and once connected - from the main UI.
- - The external scopes view will give you a professional false color map; a vectorscope; an RGB parade; audio meter; and detailed clip information including CMS.

— Center Stage support: this is enabled under iOS Settings > FiLMiC Pro > Center Stage. Once enabled under your system settings it will be available in FiLMiC Pro. Please note that at present on iOS, this feature needs to be enabled and disabled under iOS system settings, and not in FiLMiC Pro.

**All models of iPhone/iPad**:

— Lots of minor bug fixes for a smoother shooting experience.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.14.3 of FiLMiC Pro resolves a startup crash that affected devices running an early version of iOS 13. For best results with FiLMiC Pro we recommend updating to the latest version of iOS 14.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v.6.15.0 of FiLMiC Pro includes new functionality and bug fixes for an even better shooting experience:

— New audio gain control for notched iPhones that support our full height audio meter!
• We have relocated the manual audio input gain slider on large screen wide-aspect iPhones from the timecode medallion to the full height VU audio meter. This means audio input gain control is now integrated directly into the VU meter for easy gain control.
• If your iPhone supports this, look out for the ‘What’s New’ alert upon first launch after updating. This will offer to link you through to more information.
• For those devices that do not support our full height audio meter, the audio gain control remains integrated into timecode medallion.

— Bug Fixes and Performance Enhancements
• Fixed the exposure pull to point direction being inverted.
• Torch intensity icon will now always match the selected intensity.
• On supported devices, we now default to HEVC on first launch after a clean install.
• We’ve greatly improved retiming speed for vertically shot video.
• In the rare event that a recording fails to start, we now will offer to auto generate an email with diagnostic information that you can share with our team for troubleshooting purposes.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v.6.15.1 of FiLMiC Pro includes performance enhancements and bug fixes for an even better shooting experience:
— Under the hood improvements to CMS file naming and thumbnail caching.
— Better HUD messaging around DolbyVision disabling Cinematographer Kit curves when enabled.
— White balance mode now presented in the HUD when loading presets.
— Better handling of low storage events.
— Plenty of other minor bug fixes for a smoother shooting experience.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.16 of FiLMiC Pro is a major release that adds a brand-new functionality and significant performance improvements for a better capture experience.

• New Feature: Film Looks •
— FiLMiC Pro now offers real-time film looks which are available via optional in-app purchase under the Imaging Panel. Think of film looks as being akin to choosing a film stock. You get a unique filmic aesthetic in camera at the time of capture, without the need for heavy grading post workflows to arrive at a finished look.
-- Film looks are inspired by classic film stocks mixed with the look and feel of iconic films shot on them, for a unique live capture experience.
-- At launch we are offering 3 packs that each include 4 unique looks:
1. The Adamant Pack is inspired by the modern blockbuster and offers four bold and highly stylized looks.
2. The Charcoal pack is inspired by black and white cinematic greats of yesteryear, from French new wave to gritty film noir.
3. The Novus pack includes a stunning collection of film looks inspired by modern classics.
-- Film looks are fully compatible with Clean HDMI Out, allowing you to transform your device into an even more expressive professional webcam when paired with an HDMI capture card.
-- Film looks are currently available for 8-bit capture only on device with an A11 bionic or newer (iPhone 8/X or newer) and available up to 4K 30fps.

• Performance Improvements & Bug Fixes •
— Resolved a crasher that occurred on M1 iPads when revealing the manual exposure arc with Center Stage enabled.
— Improved HUD messaging.
— Slow and fast motion framerates are retained after force closing and reopening the app.
— Improvements to video pipeline to improve efficiency.
— Plenty of minor bugs squashed.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

v6.16.1 is a small update to resolve a connectivity issue that prevented users of the Zhiyun Smooth 4 from connecting their gimbals to Filmic Pro. All of the features and improvements from the previous release remain:

v6.16.2 of FiLMiC Pro includes general bug fixes and performance improvements designed for iOS 15.

— When FiLMiC Pro is launched with a film look applied, we now issue a HUD notification to let you know.

v6.16.3 of FiLMiC Pro includes further iOS 15 compatibility improvements and is recommended for all filmmakers.

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

We are proud to bring you a world first with the release of FiLMiC Pro v6.17: ProRes support! This update includes full support for ProRes capture on the iPhone 13 Pro and 13 Pro Max:

— ProRes can be selected under Settings > Resolution by scrolling down to the format picker.
— Choose one of four flavours of ProRes:
• ProRes Proxy (170Mbps*)
• ProRes LT (360Mbps*)
• ProRes 422 (540Mbps*)
• ProRes 422 HQ (735Mbps*)
— All four variants are 10-bit and offer 4:2:2 chroma subsampling and all-intra encoding!!!
— When ProRes is enabled we display a nice ‘ProRes’ badge to let you know.
— Our time remaining counter in the upper left will let you know how much approximate record time you have left.
— Did we mention this update brings full ProRes support to the 13 Pro and 13 Pro Max?

If you have any questions, suggestions or findings please contact us at support@filmicpro.com and if you enjoy shooting with FiLMiC Pro, please consider leaving us a review.

* Average bitrate achieved in our testing when filming in 4K 30fps*
** ProRes is not compatible with the Cinematographer Kit or Film Looks**
*** ProRes is limited to 30fps in 4K and 60fps in 1080p***
